reviews.review_msg: Vague about assignment expectations, class is conducted as if everyone already knows historiographical terms. Gives very little feedback on written assignments.
vague about assignments and was not helpful during tutorials. nice guy but always spaced out. doesn't interject when people ramble and lets the class get way off focus
Good prof. did not always communicate material clearly & was sometimes spaced out. the class was interesting overall and he wasn't too difficult of a marker
Worst.

It can be a bit confusing as to what Roxanne expects when doing assignments. Since this course more looks at approaches and methods as oppose to the history itself, it is hard to sift through the historical events and come up with a historical approach. Not your typical history course, though she touches on many different facets of history.

Doctor Panchasi makes learning a wonderful experience. She is an incredibly lively, knowledgeable, fun, gorgeous person and exceptionally articulate orator. I am far from doing great in this class but I would definitely take another class with her.  Her lectures are elegantly presented but the assignments could appear confusing at times.

She made what could have been my dullest course of the semester, Hst 300 approaches to History, into my favourite! She is a great facilitator and encourages class participation. She really shows that she cares about her students. I would take another course with her in a heart beat!
No Comments

She's great - always ready to help. I do agree it's sometimes hard to understand what the hell she wants on an assignment, but she's smart, passionate about her subject and genuinely interested in her students.
Such a sweetheart.

I liked her, but wish her readings had been a bit more interesting. Tough marker as well. She runs a terrific tutorial though, I'll say that for her. Genuinely interested in her subject and her students, which is nice.
Unusual teaching style: didn't so much lecture as converse with the class. Still, really nice prof, lots of energy. Like most history profs, really passionate about her discipline.
This woman is pure gold!  The class itself isn't but Panchasi will take care of you so you can survive.

She's okay, I guess. But I was really excited about this class and it didn't live up to my expectations. Boring, obscure assignments. Some really awful readings. Unreasonable (and partial)marker. But good tutorial discussions, and she's nice.
waste of time and money
Awesome prof...fair class. Tutorial discussions fantastic, assignments pesky. Worth it in the end.  No exams. Recommend any class taught by Roxanne.
Wonderful prof! Very interesting, helpful and also quite inspiring!
Amazing prof, highly entertaining and open to new ideas
Awesome prof, taken 3 classes with him and enjoyed them all.  Lectures move very fast, but it's like watching a comedy routine.  Some find marking hard, but I found it fair.

Excellent prof; except he is also a mathematician and can be extremely crafty with overall grading- is not clear about his overall marking scheme. You might get a good mark in something, but if he suspects you are not working hard enough he will figure out a way to adjust your grade...

A wonderful professor.  He made an abundance of difficult course content extremely digestible. Enthusiastic & high energy, helpful & fair.  His marking scheme & expectations are not ambiguous or ridiculous - you just have to adjust to them.

He is a great prof. Knows a lot about what he's teaching. He is a tough marker...but he explains assignments really well. His lectures are a bit hard to follow..(wright lots of notes)but he's a cutie so that makes up for it.
One of my favourite professors at SFU. Great lectures! She led our tutorial as well and it so good. Fair marker and fair tests. I never wanted to miss a class. Prof O'Brien is my favourite!
